page.title: 13LANINVAL HOUSE
page.content: Laninval house was, until recently an annexe for St. Lawrence's Hospital. It was used for the reception of voluntary patients. It was closed in April 1985. The downstairs windows are now all boarded up and the gardens are beggining to look overgrown. In the grounds, is a little known Celtic cross. Some years ao an axe head from the Beaker period was discovered in a field. This is now in Bodmin Museum. Tye property is know up for sale. It consists of a large house, extensive lawns, an orchard, a small chapel and a farm unit.
